parameter-group.name: Settings
parameter-group.label: Main Settings
parameter-group.description: Settings required to connect to the camera.

parameter-group.name: Image Settings
parameter-group.label: Snapshot/Image Settings
parameter-group.description: Settings for the snapshot features.

parameter-group.name: Streaming Setup
parameter-group.label: Stream Settings
parameter-group.description: Settings that setup or effect the video stream.

parameter.name: IMAGE_UPDATE_EVENTS
parameter.label: Update the Snapshot/Image when:
parameter.description: The Image channel can be set to Update in a number of ways to help reduce network traffic.

parameter.name: IPADDRESS
parameter.label: IP Address
parameter.description: Use this format 192.168.1.2 and do not include the port number.

parameter.name: PORT
parameter.label: The port of the camera that accepts HTTP.
parameter.description: This port will be used for http calls for fetching the snapshot and alarm states.

parameter.name: SNAPSHOT_URL_OVERRIDE
parameter.label: SNAPSHOT_URL_OVERRIDE
parameter.description: Enter a http url to where a snapshot can be seen if entered into any browser.

parameter.name: STREAM_URL_OVERRIDE
parameter.label: STREAM_URL_OVERRIDE
parameter.description: Full http address to where a MJPEG stream can be watched if entered into any browser.

parameter.name: FFMPEG_INPUT
parameter.label: FFMPEG_INPUT
parameter.description: Enter any HTTP or RTSP URL that ffmpeg can use as an input.

parameter.name: FFMPEG_LOCATION
parameter.label: FFMPEG_LOCATION
parameter.description: The full path including the filename for where you have installed ffmpeg. Default should work for Linux, but For windows use this format, c:\ffmpeg\bin\ffmpeg.exe

parameter.name: FFMPEG_OUTPUT
parameter.label: FFMPEG_OUTPUT
parameter.description: The full path where ffmpeg has the ability to write files to ending with a slash. For windows use this format, c:\openhabconf\html\ipcamera\

parameter.name: FFMPEG_HLS_OUT_ARGUMENTS
parameter.label: FFMPEG_HLS_OUT_ARGUMENTS
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own ffmpeg options to be used.
parameter.default: -f lavfi -i aevalsrc=0 -acodec aac -vcodec copy -hls_flags delete_segments -segment_list_flags live -flags -global_header

parameter.name: FFMPEG_GIF_OUT_ARGUMENTS
parameter.label: FFMPEG_GIF_OUT_ARGUMENTS
parameter.description: This gives you direct access to specify your own ffmpeg options to be used for animated GIF files.

parameter.name: GIF_PREROLL
parameter.label: GIF_PREROLL
parameter.description: Store this many snapshots from BEFORE you trigger a GIF creation.

parameter.name: GIF_POSTROLL
parameter.label: GIF_POSTROLL
parameter.description: How long in seconds to create a GIF from a stream. Alternatively if using GIF_PREROLL this is how many snapshots to use AFTER you trigger a GIF creation.

parameter.name: SERVER_PORT
parameter.label: SERVER_PORT
parameter.description: The port that will serve the video streams back to Openhab without authentication. It must be unique and unused for each camera that you setup. Setting the port to -1 which is the default, will turn all streaming off.

parameter.name: IP_WHITELIST
parameter.label: IP_WHITELIST
parameter.description: Enter any IP's or hostnames that you wish to allow to access the video stream.

parameter.name: USERNAME
parameter.label: User name for camera.
parameter.description: Enter the User name used to connect to your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use login details.

parameter.name: PASSWORD
parameter.label: Password for camera.
parameter.description: Enter Password for your camera. Leave blank if your camera does not use login details.

parameter.name: POLL_CAMERA_MS
parameter.label: Time in milliseconds between checking camera states and fetching an Image.
parameter.description: Camera states are not just alarms but can also be missing SD cards or full storage alerts. Default is "2000" which is 2 seconds.

channel-type.label: Snapshot from camera
channel-type.description: Low frame rate and low bandwidth to keep demands on your internet connection low when using to remote view.

channel-type.label: Image URL
channel-type.description: A link you can use to fetch a static image from the camera.

channel-type.label: RTSP URL
channel-type.description: A link that the camera uses for RTSP, not used currently.

channel-type.label: MJPEG URL
channel-type.description: A link you can use in Openhab/Habpanel to fetch a MJPEG video feed from the camera.

channel-type.label: HLS URL
channel-type.description: A link you can use in Openhab to cast video feeds.

channel-type.label: Last Motion Type
channel-type.description: A string that contains the type of motion alarm that was last triggered.

channel-type.label: Pan
channel-type.description: Pan the camera to an absolute position.

channel-type.label: Tilt
channel-type.description: Tilt the camera to an absolute position.

channel-type.label: Zoom
channel-type.description: Zoom the camera to an absolute value.

channel-type.label: Motion Alarm
channel-type.description: Motion has been detected.

channel-type.label: Intrusion Alarm
channel-type.description: Intrusion has detected movement. AKA Field Detection Alarm.

channel-type.label: Enable/Disable the Intrusion Alarm
channel-type.description: By using this feature you can stop the camera from sending emails when you are actually home.

channel-type.label: PIR Alarm
channel-type.description: PIR motion has been detected.

channel-type.label: Line Crossing Alarm
channel-type.description: Motion has been detected.

channel-type.label: Face Detected Alarm
channel-type.description: A face has been detected.

channel-type.label: Item Left Alarm
channel-type.description: An item has been left.

channel-type.label: Car Parking Alarm
channel-type.description: A car has triggered the ParkingDetection.

channel-type.label: Item Taken Alarm
channel-type.description: An item may have been stolen.

channel-type.label: Audio Alarm
channel-type.description: Audio has triggered an Alarm.

channel-type.label: External Alarm Input
channel-type.description: Some cameras have alarm input wires which can be used to connect to door bells or external PIR sensors.

channel-type.label: External Alarm Input 2
channel-type.description: Some cameras have alarm input wires which can be used to connect to door bells or external PIR sensors.

channel-type.label: Enable/Disable the Motion Alarm
channel-type.description: By using this feature you can stop the camera from sending emails when you are actually home.

channel-type.label: Enable/Disable the Line Crossing Alarm
channel-type.description: By using this feature you can stop the camera from sending emails when you are actually home.

channel-type.label: Enable/Disable the Audio Alarm
channel-type.description: By using this feature you can stop the camera from sending emails when you are having a party.

channel-type.label: Threshold for the Audio Alarm
channel-type.description: By moving this control you should be able to change how sensitive the audio alarm is to soft or loud noises.

channel-type.label: Trigger the cameras alarm output

channel-type.label: Trigger the cameras alarm output2

channel-type.label: Auto control the Infrared LED
channel-type.description: Turn automatic mode for the LED on and off.

channel-type.label: Enable/Disable external lights
channel-type.description: Turn the lights on and off.

channel-type.label: Doorbell
channel-type.description: The button has been pushed.
